poem:
### Reassurances from a Tower

From his high perch in the clouds,  
a lofty bird with feathers of gold,  
he chirps assurances to the ground—  
gen Z, he coos, fear not the cold.  
For the skies are only gray today,  
tomorrow, a sun sweeping bold.  
Listen closely, the words are clear,  
from a beak that's never known old.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
